message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, the history of eczema, and the recent move into affordable housing suggest a possible diagnosis of asthma. Spirometry is the most appropriate next step in management to confirm the diagnosis of asthma and assess severity. Skin prick testing may be considered later to identify triggers for the asthma, but spirometry is more urgent. Throat culture and Dihydrorhodamine 123 test are not indicated in this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's history and symptoms suggest asthma. Spirometry is the most appropriate next step in management to confirm the diagnosis of asthma and assess the severity of the disease. Skin prick testing is used to diagnose allergies, and throat culture is not indicated for asthma. The dihydrorhodamine 123 test is used to diagnose chronic granulomatous disease.
